result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond S Neeser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 5/26/15 to include credit, see below.
Concurrent with: with 14CF198.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full-time employment.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any detectable level of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall participate in any programs available to him regarding parenting.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription.
Defendant shall obtain all prescriptions for 1 pharmacy and report any changes to prescriptions to Agent within 72 hours.
Defendant shall take prescriptions in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall participate in AODA and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.

3.  pay restitution + 10% restitution surcharge.
